alert.note: Alert for Culebra (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 29 at 6:49PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AST THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Culebra. * WHEN...Until 800 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 538 PM AST, Emergency management reported that recovery operations are underway following the heavy rain caused by thunderstorms. While heavy rain is no longer anticipated, the lingering light to moderate rains might extend the duration of ongoing minor flooding across the area. Up to 5 inches of rain have fallen, and additional rainfall amounts of half an inch is possible. For this reason, the Flash Flood Warning has downgraded to a Flood Advisory.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
